title: TalkTalk joins growing list of companies raising its rates
text:
TalkTalk joins growing list of companies raising its rates TalkTalk joins growing list of companies raising its rates SANTANDER is not the only company hiking rates for loyal customers; broadband service TalkTalk is raising its charges by up to 50 per cent. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Wed, Sep 16, 2015 GETTY TalkTalk's broadband service has gone up by up to 50 per cent 
The increase on its SimplyBroadband tariff comes into force on October 1 which may see customers making a high-speed getaway. 
Hannah Maundrell, editor in- chief at Money.co.uk said this is just the latest price hike from TalkTalk: “Over the last year it has increased the cost of its flagship broadband product by 114 per cent.” 
And there are more rises to come with TalkTalk’s calling rates set to be increased from December 1. 
The latest increase comes with the sting in the tail with the exit penalty increasing from £10.50 to £13.52. 
Maundrell said: “You have 30 days to switch and escape the hiked penalty fee. 
If you don’t, you will find yourselves locked in at the higher price until the end of the contract.” Over the last year it has increased the cost of its flagship broadband product by 114 per cent Hannah Maundrell, Money.co.uk editor in-chief 
TalkTalk is not the only broadband supplier to push up rates, Maundrell said, even though there has been no increase in their wholesale line rental costs. 
Telecoms providers rate among the worst for their customer service, according to the annual Which? survey of the UK’s 100 big brands. 
BT, TalkTalk, Vodafone, and EE have some of the unhappiest customers of any top company. 
So it may be a good time to shop around. 
Websites such as BroadbandChoices.co.uk help you to compare services, including increasingly popular “quad play” deals that can save you money by bundling together your broadband, landline, mobile phone and digital TV. Related articles
